decks.notes: This deck focuses on using control elements like counterspells and removal while utilizing the graveyard as a resource with cards like Gifts Ungiven and Underworld Breach. It aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and efficiently controlling the game. The key strategy is to constantly disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up powerful graveyard synergies to secure victory. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration in the form of Moxen and other fast mana sources to ensure it can play its spells quickly and efficiently.

The main strategy of this Esper Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and board control. Utilizing a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Psychic Frog and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's progress and outvalue them in the late game. The inclusion of powerful Vintage staples like Time Walk, Timetwister, and Ancestral Recall provides additional ways to generate advantage and close out games efficiently. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game's pace and resource management to secure victory.

The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and slow down their game plan using hatebear creatures such as Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex. It also utilizes disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Void Mirror to control the board. The deck accelerates its own game plan with fast mana sources like Black Lotus, Mana Crypt, and Moxen. The aggro strategy is supported by creatures like Clarion Conqueror, Seasoned Dungeoneer, and White Plume Adventurer. The deck also includes land disruption with Wasteland and Strip Mine to further disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This deck focuses on controlling the game while utilizing the powerful combo of Oath of Druids to cheat big creatures into play. It includes powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Demonic Tutor, and Force of Will to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also includes multiple ways to find and play Oath of Druids quickly, such as Show and Tell and Forbidden Orchard. Atraxa, Grand Unifier is a key creature in this deck, helping to further control the game and provide extra value with its abilities.

The deck focuses on using Doomsday, a powerful combo card, to quickly set up a winning combination of cards that will secure victory. By carefully choosing the cards to stack with Doomsday, the deck aims to assemble a game-ending pile that includes Thassa's Oracle and the means to protect the combo with Force of Will and other counterspells. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient, utilizing powerful card draw like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time, and efficient mana acceleration like Black Lotus and Dark Ritual to quickly execute the combo and win the game.

Utilizing a combination of powerful mana acceleration, disruptive counterspells, and graveyard recursion, this Gifts Control deck aims to control the game by efficiently managing resources while digging for key combo pieces. The deck features a versatile toolkit of control elements, including counterspells, removal, and card draw, allowing the player to adapt to various matchups and strategies. By utilizing the graveyard as a resource with cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Underworld Breach, the deck can generate value and close out games with powerful win conditions like Brain Freeze or Stock Up.

The deck relies on combining powerful artifact creatures with mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing powerful artifacts like The One Ring, Mystic Forge, and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck can lock down the opponent's abilities and disrupt their game plan. The deck also includes key components like Chalice of the Void to control the opponent's spells and Grim Monolith for additional mana acceleration. Overall, the aggressive strategy of utilizing artifact creatures and mana acceleration makes this deck a formidable force in Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck revolves around utilizing Oath of Druids to quickly cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield, using cards like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm to find key pieces. Control elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation help protect the game plan, while cards like Show and Tell and Tinker offer alternative ways to get threats into play. The inclusion of versatile cards like Bolas's Citadel and Atraxa, Grand Unifier adds flexibility and additional win conditions. Overall, the deck aims to establish dominance through efficient control and powerful creature plays.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Paradoxical Outcome, combining it with other powerful cards like Urza's Saga and Underworld Breach to generate a large amount of mana and draw options. The presence of fast mana sources like Black Lotus and the Moxen allows for explosive plays, while disruption cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm help to protect the combo. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion options. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble a winning combination of cards to overpower the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through counterspells and removal while utilizing Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play. The key strategy is to quickly get Oath of Druids onto the battlefield and use it to put Atraxa, Grand Unifier or other strong creatures into play without paying their mana cost. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Null Rod and Show and Tell to disrupt opponent's plans. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game and overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the game and manipulating the board state through a combination of counterspells, card draw, and disruptive spells. The key strategy revolves around using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play, while also utilizing Show and Tell as an additional way to bring threats onto the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm for card advantage, along with cards like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor for tutoring up key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and establish a dominant position through powerful threats.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively fill up the graveyard with creatures like Poxwalkers, Grief, Basking Rootwalla, Blazing Rootwalla, and Vengevine, to enable powerful graveyard-based strategies like Dread Return. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will to control the game and protect its key pieces. Through the use of cards like Serum Powder and Bazaar of Baghdad, the deck aims to efficiently dig through the deck and set up explosive plays to overwhelm the opponent.

This Dimir Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plays while generating card advantage and controlling the board. It utilizes powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall, Demonic Tutor, and Dig Through Time alongside disruption spells like Force of Will and Fatal Push. The deck also includes efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog to pressure the opponent. Urza's Saga provides additional card advantage and utility, while Lurrus of the Dream-Den can be a valuable companion to generate value from the graveyard. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in the long game.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing efficient removal spells and countermagic to disrupt opponents while digging through the deck for key cards. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to recast small permanents from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the game by maintaining card advantage and making strategic decisions to outmaneuver the opponent. With a mix of powerful spells and disruptive elements, this deck seeks to outsmart and outlast opponents in a Vintage 1 vs 1 match.

The primary strategy of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and disruptive cards, while using Oath of Druids to bring out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes ways to manipulate the top of the library, such as Brainstorm and Merchant Scroll, to ensure Oath of Druids triggers successfully. Additionally, cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns can help manage opposing threats. Show and Tell serves as another way to cheat big creatures into play, adding another layer of unpredictability to the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through efficient control spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. It uses powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Demonic Tutor, and Dig Through Time to help set up its game plan. The deck utilizes disruptive creatures like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters to control the battlefield, while also having access to potent removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration in the form of Black Lotus and Moxen to help cast its spells ahead of schedule.
